subject: Prioritization of Projects to be implemented by NHAI under Bharatmala Pariyojana & undertaking Land Acquisition & Pre-construction Activities in Prioritized BFA Projects
text: Hray 77ry TTHrfwifearut RHV / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (sw @Rar7 3rrTHrf HATTT4) W44 / Fax : 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) v-5 & 6, Ter-10, #RWT , T ferit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 NHAI/ Policy Guidelines/ Land Acquisition/2019 No 7.1.54/2019 dated the April, 2019 (Decision taken on Note no. NHAI/OSD to Chairman/04/2019) Subject: Prioritization of Projects to be implemented by NHAI under Bharatmala   Pariyojana & undertaking Land Acquisition & Pre-construction Activities in Prioritized BFA Projects_ MoRT&H vide its OM dated 21.12.2017 issued  guidelines and SOP for implementation of Bharatmala Pariyojana: Vide OM dated 30.11.2018, MoRTH conveyed optimized / prioritized project stretches to be developed by NHAI under Bharatmala Pariyojana_ The "Projects Balance for Award (BFA Projects)" were accorded high / medium/low priority (a summary of the prioritization of BFA Projects is enclosed at Annexure-I) Subsequently, vide OM dated 04.02.2019 & 18.03.2019, MoRTH conveyed a modified list of 60 Port Connectivity Projects for 1,061 km.(list enclosed at Annexure-II) and intimated that those stretches would be taken up first  for which the State Governments provide encumbrance free land/ RoW, requisite statutory clearances (Forest/ CRZ/Environmental) , etc. and bear the cost of land acquisition, utility shifting etc Such stretches would be further prioritized depending upon commercial importance and readiness of the States as per approved Action Plan /Timelines on preconstruction activities. 2. Board of NHAI in the meeting held on 20.12.2018 directed that the pre- construction activities including LA be taken up for the identified high priority projects: While approving an expenditure Rs.15 Cr. per km_ for pre- construction activities including LA in such high priority projects, Board directed Executive Committee to formulate   guidelines for proper utilization of   funds, within the ceiling approved (Rs.15 Cr. per km:) . 3_ Further, in the meeting held on 10.01.2019, the Board of NHAI directed to prioritize the high priority projects in order to ensure that the sanctions being accorded to the projects are within the approved cost of Bharatmala Pariyojana: The Board also directed that the extent of land acquisition should be brought down and the land acquisition on non-priority projects should be   stopped immediately.
